intro: Melampyrum hastatum, commonly known as yellow false foxglove, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Oxyglossaceae family and typically grows in moist, calcareous soils. The plant features slender, erect stems with lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are yellow and occur in clusters, with a distinctive spurred shape. It is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along streambanks, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
